subject: Add factory reset page
commitMessage:
Add factory reset page

This new page will be included in the Control section of the primary
navigation. The user will be able to choose between two different
reset actions.

The  user  can make the following calls:
- /redfish/v1/Systems/system/Bios/Actions/Bios.ResetBios
- /redfish/v1/Managers/bmc/Actions/Manager.ResetToDefaults

Signed-off-by: Derick Montague <derick.montague@ibm.com>
Change-Id: I32a10dbce27a03fb84e24d7eae7c44eef9cffea5

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as da9f0a6e62ff0f70cb8e82d8489369003826f502 by Derick Montague
this is the <b-form-group>, we would normally put helper text around here, line 10
All good, looked out layout, this makes sense 👍
nitpick, since this will only resolve to a single value, resetOption (without 's') may be a better name
curious why you chose to leave the helper text nested here, I think we usually place the helper text as a direct child of <b-form group> usually at the top before the form controls

I'll have to look, but there is no b-form-group being used. If we are placing above the actual element we would need to change the order using flexbox in order for the design to be rendered correctly. Maybe I am missing something?
We have b-form-group on line 9? maybe I'm missing something?
All good, looked out layout, this makes sense 👍
was this needed? I know we chatted a bit about the loader on this page...I don't think by default that the loader should show at all when navigating between pages? (may need to double check on that)
If the page is refreshed using the browser, the empty loader container is shown.
could maybe wrap this entire block in a <template> tag instead of adding v-if to each component
This should probably be all caps
All our other toasts end with a period
is this different from the FactoryResetModal?
This should not be here. Same with the reset to defaults. I actually had two branches. One single and one double modal. This should not have been included
doesn't seem like you are doing anything with this in the component view

you have a success message returned in the store too. Is there a reason you chose to use the title instead of the standard toast body?
I think we've deviated in some places but very early on, we decided to handle toast message responses in the store (since it is closer to the API calls), may want to revisit if no longer following this pattern
We have definitely not been consistent and seen it both ways. What is  your preference? It doesn't matter to me.

I chose title, because I don't want the title to be "Success" and don't have a message body. Am I not understanding how to use the component you created?

If that is the case, then the only thing we need here is dispatch. I am good with that and will make that change, but I followed the pattern you used in the firmware.

> We have definitely not been consistent and seen it both ways. What is  your preference? It doesn't matter to me.

I think I prefer the store...the initial thinking behind that was if we eventually want to provide more specific feedback based on the API response (different messages based on different status codes), it would be easier to do from the store


> I chose title, because I don't want the title to be "Success" and don't have a message body. Am I not understanding how to use the component you created?

Yeah, makes sense, you didn't want 'Success' in your toast title, right? I think for firmware (in one of the builds/iterations) I got around the potentially misleading success notification by using an info toast, with 'Success' as the title. But I think this also works (wondering if the spacing in the toast is weird though, could maybe use an extra check in the BVToastMixin for empty strings)

I think firmware is where we first deviated from the pattern of toast translations in the store. This was because the toasts we used for firmware were more complex than any we had before, requiring a custom title and body
In the latest firmware code (https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/webui-vue/+/40722/3/src/views/Configuration/Firmware/FirmwareFormUpdate.vue#7), I think it makes sense for the info toasts to be handled in the SFC, because they aren't shown based on any response from the API
That makes perfect sense to me. I will update to push the toast messages into the store. This is a very simple implementation.
Do we need double quote for this sentence? Here it has been added only at the end.
no need to invoke, only need to provide the method name
Nope...It is a remnant from pre-refactor. Nice catch!

Instead of adding this extra check, could you try using the requiredIf vuelidate validator, so the confirmation would only be required if the host is powered on?

https://vuelidate.js.org/#sub-builtin-validators
requiredIf won't work, but I updated the validations option and removed the isFormValid function.

this should destructure the 'message' property on the Error. Since you are throwing an error from the store, we'll need to use the message property to use the translation provided to the constructor 

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Error/message
I think you can use an alias though, if you wanted to locally assign to title...I think it would be { message: title }

I don't this this will work. The toast mixin expects either a string or an array of strings as the first argument, this implementation may show something like 'Object object' in the toast

https://openbmc.github.io/webui-vue/guide/components/toasts/#additional-options

Need more of a commit msg than this. This adds 350 lines of code. 
Why add this page? 
What does this page do?
Why does it make 2 calls?
Is there anything special about the design of this page?
I'll add a few bullet points.
How is this different than partition configurations ?
Platform keystore isn't covered by "partition configurations" ?
I don't know the answer to that.
Great question. The designers were discussing with some of the engineers what was needed. If we think that these are the same, we could remove them. It was asked that we include them.
Those are three distinct pieces of data (I do understand they are all inside the same file) and we wanted to make it clear to the customer that they were all being cleared with this operation.
Doesn't this initiate a BMC reboot..? I.e. "requires" makes me think the user needs to do something.
It does and that is a good point. Might make more sense to suggest that it will cause a reboot.
